get.description: Full team information: team name and city, league and division, and colors. Also contains basic fantasy info such as IDs as well as full stadium data. This endpoint returns the teams currently active in the league.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

get.description: Returns all stadiums in the league with capacity, surface, latitude/longitude, city and state (and where applicable country.)

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

get.description: Home and away teams, date and time, season type and week etc. are included. Also includes gameday information. This includes full stadium information (capacity, lat/long, surface etc.), top-line betting information (spread, moneyline, total), weather conditions, and broadcast information.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: season
parameters.description:
Year of the season (with optional season type).
Examples: 2018, 2018PRE, 2018POST, 2018STAR, 2019, etc.

get.description: Full scores and gameday info delivered live and post-game. Live data includes innings, scores, pitch count etc. Gameday info includes referee, weather, TV channel etc.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: date
parameters.description:
The date of the game(s).
Examples: 2017-JUL-31, 2017-SEP-01.

get.description: Full player bio and details, including injury notes, for all active players.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

get.description: Full player bio and details, including injury notes, for all available free agents unattached to a team.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

get.description: Full player bio and details, including injury notes, for all available players by team.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: team
parameters.description:
The abbreviation of the requested team.
Examples: SF, NYY.

get.description: Returns the box score statistical record team-wide (aggregated from all players) for a given team's game in a given week, both live and post-game.
get.summary: Team Game Stats - by Date [Live & Final]

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: date
parameters.description:
The date of the game(s).
Examples: 2017-JUL-31, 2017-SEP-01.

get.description: Returns all season-long stats (i.e. the season total, not each individual game record) for all teams (aggregated from all players) for a given season.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: season
parameters.description:
Year of the season.
Examples: 2017, 2018.

get.description: Basic RotoBaller news feed, with limited stories available - usually 0-1 stories per day. Ideal for test purposes.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: date
parameters.description:
The date of the news.
Examples: 2017-JUL-31, 2017-SEP-01.

get.description: Basic RotoBaller news feed, with limited stories available - usually 0-1 stories per day. Ideal for test purposes.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

get.description: Basic RotoBaller news feed, with limited stories available - usually 0-1 stories per day. Ideal for test purposes.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: playerid
parameters.description: Unique FantasyData Player ID. Example:10000507.

get.description: Returns true if there is at least one game being played at the time of the request or false if there are none.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

get.description: Player Details - by Player

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: playerid
parameters.description: Unique FantasyData Player ID. Example:10000507.

get.description: Year of the current season. This value changes at the start of the new league year. For leagues that run over two years, this is the year the season starts, not ends.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

get.description: Includes regular season standings in division and league, from which postseason seeding can be derived.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: season
parameters.description:
Year of the season.
Examples: 2017, 2018.

get.description: Full team information: team name and city, league and division, and colors. Also contains basic fantasy info such as IDs as well as full stadium data. This endpoint returns all teams regardless of current active status.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

get.description: Game by game log of total team statistics.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: season
parameters.description: Season to get games from. Example 2019POST, 2020

parameters.name: teamid
parameters.description: Unique ID of team. Example 12

parameters.name: numberofgames
parameters.description: How many games to return. Example all, 10, 25

get.description: A lightweight schedule endpoint without gameday information. Home and away teams, the date and time of the game, and season type, week etc. are included. Ideal for the most basic information required to build a schedule.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: season
parameters.description:
Year of the season (with optional season type).
Examples: 2018, 2018PRE, 2018POST, 2018STAR, 2019, etc.

get.description: A more stripped-down list of players on a given team, for simple applications.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: team
parameters.description:
The abbreviation of the requested team.
Examples: SF, NYY.

get.description: This endpoint simply delivers the innings count and total score live; no down and distance and no gameday info such as weather.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: date
parameters.description:
The date of the game(s).
Examples: 2017-JUL-31, 2017-SEP-01.

get.description: This is a beta endpoint in development. The endpoint issues a token for mlb:game:gamestate.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

get.description: A more stripped-down list of players on a given team, for simple applications, including all active players.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

get.description: A more stripped-down list of players on a given team, for simple applications, sorted by free agents.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

get.description: A slimmed-down score endpoint, giving just the innings scores and final score, for simple applications. Delivered after the game ends.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: date
parameters.description:
The date of the game(s).
Examples: 2017-JUL-31, 2017-SEP-01.

get.description: Full scores and gameday info, including weather, referee, infotainment odds, as well as all of the innings scores and full-time score, delivered as the game ends.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: date
parameters.description:
The date of the game(s).
Examples: 2017-JUL-31, 2017-SEP-01.

get.description: Returns the box score statistical record team-wide (aggregated from all players) for all games on a given date after the game has concluded.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: date
parameters.description:
The date of the game(s).
Examples: 2017-JUL-31, 2017-SEP-01.

get.description: List of teams playing in a specified season, with their profile info.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: season
parameters.description:
Year of the season and the season type. If no season type is provided, then the default is regular season.
Examples: 2015REG, 2015PRE, 2015POST.

get.description: A list of transactions, such as assignments, placement on the injury list, player trades etc., delivered by date.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: date
parameters.description:
The date of the news.
Examples: 2015-JUL-31, 2015-SEP-01.
